de: Eine Wanderung ohne Schwierigkeiten zwischen Luberon und Concors, entlang des Kanals.
en: A hike without difficulties between Luberon and Concors, along the canal.
it: Un'escursione senza difficoltà tra Luberon e Concors, lungo il canale.
fr: Une randonnée sans difficultés entre Luberon et Concors, le long du canal.
es: Una caminata sin dificultades entre Luberon y Concors, a lo largo del canal.
nl: Een wandeling zonder moeilijkheden tussen Luberon en Concors, langs het kanaal.

en:
1. From the Peyrolles tourist office, cross the Place des Héros (public toilets). Pass the statue erected in memory of the men of the village who left for the 14-18 war, then cross the road. On the right, at the square under the chapel of St Sépulcre (12th century), go up the rue Ste Anne, towards the Loubatas. After the Ste Anne bridge, on the EDF canal, turn right onto the Chemin du Canal. This canal, used for irrigation, drinking water supply and electricity production, was built by Électricité de France in the 1960s, by diverting part of the waters of the Durance.

2. Continue on the Chemin du Canal, then at the next bridge, turn left onto the Chemin de St Marc which climbs the hill of Perembrum. 100 m after the last house, you will see a beautiful white oak tree on your right, with its conch (water hole at the foot of the tree) and a blue beacon. Further up, turn left. The path leads to a track and narrows as you go up. Be careful: at the next small crossroads, under the large Aleppo pines, turn right and the path follows a restanque.

3. Follow the edge of the restanque, to reach a viewpoint over the Concors woods, at the top a lookout for the Defense des Forêts Contre les Incendies (from June to September). The path follows the slope on the edge of the bancaou (terrace cultivation) and joins several paths, one of which has a white gate. In the undergrowth, you can find Nice euphorbia. Opposite this property, take the path that descends to the tarmac road (be careful), and then descend for about 100m. Near the containers, take the left-hand side of the road on the dirt track. Further on, cross the field of olive trees.

4. After the olive field, follow path no. CO206, which runs alongside several properties, with few downhill or uphill stretches. The path comes to a bend in a wide forest track. Go down this track (due north), over the small pass, the track zigzags to the canal. Cross the canal, by the bridge and then by the houses, and follow the road under the canal to the Notre Dame d'Astors chapel (listed as a historical monument in 1940) located between the road and the canal, in the shade of the large White and Green Oaks.

5. Take the road from where you arrived. After the houses (old pigsty), go down the tarmac road for 150 m, then turn right and walk along the Canal de Peyrolles to the village. From this part of the walk, you can see the Durance valley to the north, as well as a long avenue of plane trees on the Route des Alpes, and a remarkable oak tree in the shape of a giant parasol... After the housing estate and the water treatment plant (the canal is used to evacuate waste water), turn left into Rue Aimé Bernard and after the school, turn right into Rue du St Sépulcre. On your left you will see the chapel built on a rocky promontory. Finally, return to the tourist office via the stairs, the square and the First World War memorial.

de: Die Gemeinde Peyrolles-en-Provence liegt im Durance-Tal, nördlich der Grand Site Sainte Victoire (zu der sie gehört), und enthüllt Ihnen auf dieser Wanderroute ihren ganzen Reichtum an Kulturerbe und Umwelt. Zunächst entdecken Sie im Dorf das Schloss von König René, die Palmengrotte (ein in Europa einzigartiges Relikt), die Kapelle St Sépulcre... Anschließend führt die Route (hauptsächlich auf Waldwegen oder -pfaden ohne besondere Schwierigkeiten) durch den Kiefernwald und mündet in einige offene Flächen, von denen aus Sie einen freien Blick auf das Durance-Tal, das Dorf, den Luberon, die Wälder von Concors und seinen Wachposten sowie den Défilé de Mirabeau genießen können. Schließlich führt die Wanderung entlang der Kanäle zur Kapelle Notre Dame d'Astors, der ursprünglichen Wiege von Peyrolles, mit Überresten von Wandmalereien.
en: Situated in the Durance valley, to the north of the Grand Site Sainte Victoire (of which it is a part), the commune of Peyrolles-en-Provence will reveal to you, in the course of this pedestrian itinerary, all its patrimonial and environmental wealth. First, in the village, you will discover the Château du roi René, the Grotte aux Palmiers (a unique vestige in Europe), the Chapelle St Sépulcre... Then, the itinerary (mainly composed of paths or forest tracks with no particular difficulties) goes through the pine forest and leads to some open areas, allowing you to enjoy clear views of: the Durance valley, the village, the Luberon, the Concors woods and its watchtower, the Mirabeau gorge. Finally, the walk follows the canals to the chapel of Notre Dame d'Astors, the primitive cradle of Peyrolles, which has the remains of wall frescoes.
it: Situato nella valle della Durance, a nord del Grand Site Sainte Victoire (di cui fa parte), il comune di Peyrolles-en-Provence vi svelerà, nel corso di questo itinerario pedonale, tutta la sua ricchezza patrimoniale e ambientale. In primo luogo, nel villaggio, scoprirete lo Château du roi René, la Grotte aux Palmiers (vestigia unica in Europa), la Chapelle St Sépulcre... Poi, l'itinerario (composto principalmente da sentieri o piste forestali senza particolari difficoltà) attraversa la pineta e conduce ad alcune aree aperte, permettendo di godere di una chiara vista su: la valle della Durance, il villaggio, il Luberon, il bosco di Concors e la sua torre di guardia, le gole del Mirabeau. Infine, la passeggiata segue i canali fino alla cappella di Notre Dame d'Astors, la culla primitiva di Peyrolles, che conserva resti di affreschi murali.
fr: Située dans la vallée de la Durance, au nord du Grand Site Sainte Victoire (dont elle fait partie), la commune de Peyrolles-en-Provence vous dévoilera, au fil de cet itinéraire pédestre, toute sa richesse patrimoniale et environnementale. D'abord dans le village, vous découvrirez le Château du roi René, la Grotte aux Palmiers (vestige unique en Europe), la Chapelle St Sépulcre... Ensuite, l'itinéraire (composé principalement des chemins ou pistes forestières sans difficultés particulières) parcourt la pinède et débouche sur quelques milieux ouverts, permettant de bénéficier de points de vue dégagés sur: la vallée de la Durance, le village, le Lubéron, les bois de Concors et sa vigie, le Défilé de Mirabeau. Enfin, la balade suit les canaux jusqu'à la chapelle de Notre Dame d'Astors berceau primitif de Peyrolles, elle possède des vestiges de fresques murales.
es: Situado en el valle del Durance, al norte del Grand Site Sainte Victoire (del que forma parte), el municipio de Peyrolles-en-Provence le revelará, en el transcurso de este itinerario peatonal, toda su riqueza patrimonial y medioambiental. En primer lugar, en el pueblo, descubrirá el Château du roi René, la Grotte aux Palmiers (un vestigio único en Europa), la Chapelle St Sépulcre... A continuación, el itinerario (compuesto principalmente por senderos o pistas forestales sin dificultades particulares) atraviesa el bosque de pinos y conduce a algunas zonas abiertas, lo que permite disfrutar de vistas despejadas de: el valle del Durance, el pueblo, el Luberon, el bosque de Concors y su torre de vigilancia, el desfiladero de Mirabeau. Por último, el paseo sigue los canales hasta la capilla de Notre Dame d'Astors, cuna primitiva de Peyrolles, que conserva restos de frescos murales.
nl: De gemeente Peyrolles-en-Provence, gelegen in de vallei van de Durance, ten noorden van de Grand Site Sainte Victoire (waarvan ze deel uitmaakt), zal u tijdens deze wandelroute al haar rijkdom op het gebied van erfgoed en milieu laten zien. Eerst ontdekt u in het dorp het Château du roi René, de Grotte aux Palmiers (een uniek overblijfsel in Europa), de Chapelle St Sépulcre... Vervolgens loopt de route (hoofdzakelijk paden of bospaden zonder bijzondere moeilijkheden) door het dennenbos en voert naar enkele open gebieden, waar u kunt genieten van heldere uitzichten op: de vallei van de Durance, het dorp, de Luberon, het bos van Concors en zijn wachttoren, de kloof van Mirabeau. Tot slot volgt de wandeling de grachten naar de kapel Notre Dame d'Astors, de primitieve bakermat van Peyrolles, met overblijfselen van muurfresco's.
